intro: Wachendorfia villosa, commonly known as the Woolly Wachendorfia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Wachendorfia villosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
